title: Shakira will be headlining Super Bowl with Jennifer Lopez on birthday
text:
We cannot wait (Picture: Getty)

The 2020 Super Bowl is going to be massive for Shakira for more than one reason, as the singer – who is headlining alongside Jennifer Lopez – will be performing on her birthday.

Shakira (Shakira) will turn 43 on the 2 February, the day she takes to the famous stage for the half-time show alongside JLo.

And she’s amped!

Not only because it’s her birthday and she’ll be with the Hustlers actress, but Jay-Z is also producing the thing.

It’s just going to be big, we know it now.

Such a big birthday for Shakira (Picture: WireImage)

‘It’s going to be on my birthday. I’ve always wanted to perform at the Super Bowl. I think it’s like the holy grail of the entertainment industry,’ Shakira told Zane Lowe on Apple Music’s Beats 1.

‘It’s a sports event, but it has a huge relevance for us artists, and I think it’s going to be fantastic. And I’m going to be celebrating my birthday with 100 million people. A small party. It’s surreal, it’s kind of surreal actually.

‘Jay-Z is producing the show. And he called me, and he asked me if I wanted to be a part of that. And of course I didn’t hesitate. I said, “Of course, count on me.”’

After the 99 Problems star mentioned he had also got Jennifer on board, Shakira knew she had to join, seeing as, according to Shakira, Jennifer ‘represents a really important part of the Latino community who lives in the US, and who has been born and raised in the US’.

JLo will take her rightful place on stage (Picture: Getty Images North America)

She added: ‘And I think in a way, I feel that I’m representing another part of the Latin world, which is all those people around the globe who almost barely speak English.’

The Hips Don’t Lie star said it will also be a celebration of women in the music industry, as she continued: ‘It’s going to be very short, therefore very nerve wracking, I think. But the wheels are already turning, and I can’t stop thinking of ideas. Every day I have a new idea.

‘And so now, it’s a matter of making them all work together and having the time to consolidate all of that and present the best show that… of my career. I mean, I hope in four minutes or five minutes, or whatever it is.’

Last month it was announced the dynamite duo would take to the stage half way through the game that stops the world.

In an interview with Fox for Thursday Night Football, JLo said in September she ‘loves that [Super Bowl 2020] is in Miami’ because ‘it is a very Latino town’, while Shakira said she was ‘incredibly honoured and humbled’ to be next to JLo ‘representing the Latino community’.

‘They are such an important force in the United States,’ she said.

Jennifer continued: ‘I love that the Super Bowl has two women performing this year, that they have two Latinas.

‘For me it’s the 100th anniversary but it’s also a marker of time, and a new time, not just for the NFL but also for this country.

‘It sends an important message to the world, to everyone.’

Maroon 5 fronted the last Super Bowl half-time show, and were joined by Travis Scott and Big Boi on the night.
